reviews.review_msg: She's not that great of a prof.  Her lectures are organized but she puts too much emphasis on art history that doesn't usually have any relevance.  Her assignments and exams are not fun, especially since she doesn't allow a wide range of topics.  She picks one topic and makes everyone write about it.
She talks alot, but also confuses me. I think she just talks about all irrelevant contents instead of useful course content. I learned nothing from her, but alot from the courseware..

Sharla Sava made interesting material dull and monotonous. Her jokes are not funny, and she seems to go off on tangents. I wasn't looking forward to this class going into it, and Sharla didn't help at all. The TA, Nils Olson, however, was a really nice guy who actually enlightened me to the material.

TERRIBLE!! SHE'S THE WORST! this class made NO sense whatsoever! i was at almost every lecture, and tutorial, and still could figure out what her point is. The course materials are useless and she doesnt' know what she's talking about. Good Luck!

Worst prof I've had @ SFU.  Extremely boring and at times doesn't seem like she really knows what she's talking about.  She does mix in a lot of art into lecture since thats her background, unfortunately it has no relevance whatsoever to the course material.  I don't think she's mean or anything, she's just a really bad prof.
One of the worst teachers I've had in a long time, the material she teaches is so dry and boring. Likes to relate concepts with art works and old clips. Not my style but what the hell
